examples: The constant criticism was wearing her down and making her feel exhausted.

images.alt: Photo of a person with her head on her computer keyboard.
images.description: Photo of a person with her head on her computer keyboard.
images.caption: Working at a computer all day can be wearing.

source.title: Woman Sitting on Chair While Leaning on Laptop
source.author: Andrea Piacquadio

meanings.definition: A widely held but fixed and oversimplified image or idea of a particular type of person or thing.
examples: There are stereotypes that assume that men are not good at some things, such as cooking. That's not true!
She has a lot of concerns about paying all her bills right now.

images.alt: Photo of a person with a worried expression talking on a telephone.
images.description: Photo of a person with a worried expression talking on a telephone.
images.caption: Concerns can arise for many reasons, making someone anxious.

source.title: Anxious woman having phone conversation in office
source.author: Karolina Grabowska

meanings.definition: The ability to make considered decisions or come to sensible conclusions.
examples: They took their time before they made their judgment about who was responsible for the accident.

meanings.definition: Of or having to do with Africa, or its people or languages.

images.alt: Photo of a person feeding a giraffe.
images.caption: Giraffes are African animals.
